drupalNodeEvent.title: Deals & Disputes: China, Hong Kong, and Commercial Law

field_speakers.processed: Susan Finder (Peking University), Antony Dapiran, Eva Pils (King's College), Pierre Landry (CUHK), Michael Davis (Weatherhead East Asia Institute), Huang Jie (University of Sydney), Ronald Brand (University of Pittsburgh), Peter Trooboff (Covington & Burling), Zhang Wenliang (Renmin University), YEO Tiong Min (Singapore Management University), Julien Chaisse (City University of Hong Kong), James Cook (University of Pittsburgh), and Shahla Ali (UHK)

field_organizers.processed: Asian Studies Center, Center for International Legal Education, University of Pittsburgh

field_description.processed: Join us for virtual sessions over the course of three days that will consider the structure, reach, and impact of China’s Belt & Road Initiative and its implications for commercial relations, dispute resolution, and the future of legal developments in Asia more generally. Three panels will focus on fundamental issues of dispute resolution in US-China business contracts; the evolving of dispute resolution forums in Asia; and the future of Hong Kong as a hub for commercial relationships in the Asian region. Two keynote addresses will consider the critical recent development of China’s International Commercial Court and the importance of Hong Kong.
